article:
{{Infobox award
| name = Academy Award for Best Actor description = Best Performance by an Actor
| in a Leading Role presenter = Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences
| country = United States year = 1929 (for performances in films released during
| the 1927/1928 film season) holder = Daniel Day-Lewis, [[Lincoln (2012
| film)|Lincoln]] (2012) website =
}} 'Performance by an Actor in a Leading Role' is one of the Academy Awards of
Merit presented annually by the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences
(AMPAS) to recognize an actor who has delivered an outstanding performance while
working within the film industry. Prior to the 49th Academy Awards ceremony
(1976), this award was simply known as the Academy Award of Merit for
Performance by an Actor. Since its inception, however, the award has commonly
been referred to as the Oscar for 'Best Actor'. While actors are nominated for
this award by Academy members who are actors and actresses themselves, winners
are selected by the Academy membership as a whole.
categories: Films featuring a Best Actor Academy Award winning performance|
headings: Multiple awards for Best Actor & Best Supporting Actor combined
Multiple nominations for Best Actor & Best Supporting Actor combined
